hanzi-su-wiki:
閥

Значения

Группа, клика

Мнемоника

Триумфальные ворота 門, через которые проходят вооруженные солдаты 伐 с военачальниками в значении «аристократия». Сейчас — группа, клика.

Варианты

阀
purpleculture_pinyin:
fá
powerful individual, family or group; clique; (loanword) valve
влиятельный человек, семья или группа; клика; (заимствованное слово) клапан
rtega_mnemonic:
閥閥RS
阀阀		clique, lineage, threshold
  • porch 門 of the house of an important clique guarded by a man with axe 伐, don't try to fringe his threshold
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 阀)
Pictophonetic: 伐 indicates the sound; 門 (gate) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 閥門 [ fá mén ]: valve (mechanical)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 伐 [ fá ] cut down, subjugate, attack
heisig_chinese_memo: You set a guard at the gate to fell intruders not of your clique. If he doesn't recognize them, he turns the valve to open the door and release the hounds.
koohiiStory1: You only get through the gates into that person's fiesta if you are in the same clique.
koohiiStory2: The felled souls of the world, cut down like trees, pass through the gates of hell and join the clique.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Passed out in front of the gate lies a drunkard who used to be the leader of a popular clique, the Cool Kids Clan. Once, he was a leader, but now he is but a drunkard. The clan has fallen apart, and he no longer has a clique to call his own.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this washed up drunkard leader passed out in front of the gate to your house. You have to pass him whenever you enter or exit your house. He’s gross and he smells. Experience the stench in your nostrils. How he was ever the leader of a clan you have no idea.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Eventually you get sick and tired of this washed up clan leader and you gather your own clique to chase this guy away from your gate and your property. You and your friends grab some bats (ばつ) and use these bats to beat the drunkard leader. Being beaten with bats frightens him, and he scurries away.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hear the crushing blows of bats against flesh as you imagine this scene in your mind. You’re beating the crap out of this guy with a bunch of bats, but hey – he had it coming.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 伐 (きる、バツ вырубать, карать).
Ru_trainchinese: fá: (сущ) задвижка, клапан; знать, каста (в феодальные времена); знатные и влиятельные люди, аристократия
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you fell (伐) the gate (門) around the clique
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A valve got loose on the gate so it the whole gate fell.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " door ", " cut " sound, the original meaning is merit. "Shu Wen Xin Attached": "The lords read from the preface. From the door, the sound is cut." Song Ouyang Xiu "Sang Yi Biography": "The secret secretary of the capital said: "Silver with me, for the emperor to work together." Yi said "It’s not my desire to use bribes to win officials. It’s poor and no silver, and you can’t be solid." The official is angry and hides his power.

The " valve " can represent the post on the left side of the door by the official family. "Jade Pian‧ Door": "On the left, it is said that the valve is, and on the right is it is read." Song Wen Tianxiang (Tong Dong Tiju Kaiqi): "The valve crowns the sky, the sky is high."

" Valve " also means the official officialdom, the famous giant room. Tang Hanyu "Send Wenchang Master to the North Tour": "Recommended gentry to be a writer and apprentice, and his reputation is shining."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " door ", " cutting ", the original meaning is merit.
humanum_full_description:
從「門」，「伐」聲，本義為功績。《說文新附》：「閥閱自序也。从門，伐聲。」 宋歐陽修《桑懌傳》：「京師樞密吏謂曰：『與我銀，為君致閤職。』懌曰：『用賂得官，非我欲，況貧無銀，有固不可也。』吏怒，匿其閥。」

　　「閥」可表示仕宦人家自序功狀而樹立在門外左邊的柱子。《玉篇‧門部》：「在左曰閥，在右曰閱。」宋文天祥〈通董提舉楷啟〉：「閥冠雲霄，樓高湖海。」

　　「閥」也表示仕宦門第、名門巨室。唐韓愈〈送文暢師北游〉：「薦紳秉筆徒，聲譽耀前閥。」

(Simplified: 阀)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 伐 indicates the sound; 門 (gate) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 伐 [ fá ] cut down, subjugate, attack
①古代指有權勢的家庭：門閥。閥閱(封建時代指有功勳、有權勢的世家。亦作“伐閱”。
②憑藉權勢造成特殊地位的個人或集團(含貶義)：軍閥。財閥。黨閥。
③機器中調節流體流量、壓力和流動方向的裝置，［例］截止閥、單向閥、減壓閥、安全閥等。亦稱“閥門”、“活門”。
閥門 [ fá mén ]: valve (mechanical)
(Simplified: 阀)

從「 門 」，「 伐 」聲，本義為功績。《說文新附》：「閥閱自序也。从門，伐聲。」 宋歐陽修《桑懌傳》：「京師樞密吏謂曰：『與我銀，為君致閤職。』懌曰：『用賂得官，非我欲，況貧無銀，有固不可也。』吏怒，匿其閥。」 「 閥 」可表示仕宦人家自序功狀而樹立在門外左邊的柱子。《玉篇‧門部》：「在左曰閥，在右曰閱。」宋文天祥〈通董提舉楷啟〉：「閥冠雲霄，樓高湖海。」 「 閥 」也表示仕宦門第、名門巨室。唐韓愈〈送文暢師北游〉：「薦紳秉筆徒，聲譽耀前閥。」
From " door", " cut" sound, the original meaning is merit. "Shu Wen Xin Attached": "The lords read from the preface. From the door, the sound is cut." Song Ouyang Xiu "Sang Yi Biography": "The secret secretary of the capital said: "Silver with me, for the emperor to work together." Yi said "It’s not my desire to use bribes to win officials. It’s poor and no silver, and you can’t be solid." The official is angry and hides his power. The " valve" can represent the post on the left side of the door by the official family. "Jade Pian‧ Door": "On the left, it is said that the valve is, and on the right is it is read." Song Wen Tianxiang (Tong Dong Tiju Kaiqi): "The valve crowns the sky, the sky is high." " Valve" also means the official officialdom, the famous giant room. Tang Hanyu "Send Wenchang Master to the North Tour": "Recommended gentry to be a writer and apprentice, and his reputation is shining."

閥字的基本解释

閥
fá
见“阀”。

閥字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fá］
［《廣韻》房越切，入月，奉。］
“阀1”的繁体字。
(1)功绩。
(2)仕宦人家自序功状而树立在门外左边的柱子。
(3)仕宦门第；名门巨室。
(4)指在某一方面有支配势力的人物或家族。
(5)［英valve］通称活门。也称阀门、凡尔。管道、泵或其他机器中调节和控制流体的流量、压力和流动方向的装置。种类很多，如气阀、水阀、油阀等。

閥字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　閥； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1334第19
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】房越切【正韻】房滑切，?音伐。【說文】閥閱，自序也。【韻會】閥閱功狀。【史記·功臣年表】人臣功有五品，明其等曰閥，積日曰閱。　又【正韻】門在左曰閥，在右曰閱。又【正字通】元朝品制有爵者，其門爲烏頭閥閱。【冊府元龜】閥閱二柱，相去一丈，柱端置瓦筒，號爲烏頭。　又【說文】通用伐。【左傳·成十六年】卻至驟稱其伐。【杜預註】伐，功也。又【前漢·車千秋傳】無伐閱功勞。【註】師古曰：伐，積功也。

考證：〔又【說文】通用伐。【左傳·成十六年】卻至驟稱其伐閱。【註】所踐歷也。〕　謹照原文省閱字，並照原註改杜預註伐功也。

(1) Merit.
(2) Officials and eunuchs set up the pillar on the left outside the door.
(3) No. of official officials; a giant room of famous families.
(4) Refers to a person or family who has dominant power in a certain aspect.
(5) [British valve] is commonly called valve. Also known as valve, valve. A device that regulates and controls the flow, pressure, and direction of fluid in pipes, pumps, or other machines. There are many types, such as air valve, water valve, oil valve and so on.

Name meaning

fá
вм. 阀
Radicals: 門, ｲ, 戈  (gate, leader, drunkard)
Meaning Mnemonic
Passed out in front of the gate lies a drunkard who used to be the leader of a popular clique, the Cool Kids Clan. Once, he was a leader, but now he is but a drunkard. The clan has fallen apart, and he no longer has a clique to call his own.
Imagine this washed up drunkard leader passed out in front of the gate to your house. You have to pass him whenever you enter or exit your house. He’s gross and he smells. Experience the stench in your nostrils. How he was ever the leader of a clan you have no idea.
Reading Mnemonic
Eventually you get sick and tired of this washed up clan leader and you gather your own clique to chase this guy away from your gate and your property. You and your friends grab some bats (ばつ) and use these bats to beat the drunkard leader. Being beaten with bats frightens him, and he scurries away.
Hear the crushing blows of bats against flesh as you imagine this scene in your mind. You’re beating the crap out of this guy with a bunch of bats, but hey – he had it coming.
